Both museums will be powered by solar panels and will be able to draw 40 percent more power from their sunlit environs than they could from their normal indoor spaces. Both of the institutions—which were bought and renovated by the Guggenheim in partnership with the Rockefeller Foundation—will also boast new glass, new wood, and steel.The Guggenheim’s new six, eight, and ten-story buildings, which were built with a total of $5 billion, are nestled in the heart of the arts district of Lower Manhattan. The new spaces, which were designed by the Guggenheim in partnership with New York–based firm I.M. Pei, employ a combination of solar panels and photovoltaic cells to generate electricity.
